intro: Dabanus acuminatus, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family.
